reviews.review:
Quizá el episodio más corto de los 3, aún asi no deja de ser un gran juego. Mejoras gráficas que afectan positivamente la entrega anterior, si tienes los 2 episodios instalados. En cuanto a contenido de juego, continuamos con la historía inmediatamente después de lo ocurrido en la última misión. Como novedades ahora tendremos siempre la compañia de Alyx durante nuestra aventura y un nuevo tipo de zombie que le agrega más desafio a la forma de jugar.

El juego sigue enganchando por su excelente historia, además de los misterios que, hasta el día de hoy, no se han aclarado.  Igual que el anterior título, lo volvi a jugar por tercera vez después de casi 10 años de haberlo jugado por primera vez. De lo bueno poco, así es el Episodio Uno de Half Life 2.
La continuacion de la historia de Half Life, tiene todo lo que tenia el Half Life 2, aunque si es muy corto, pero merece la pena si quieres saber que paso despues de Half LIfe 2
Almost as good as Half life 2, and Half life two episode 2, but still amazing

10/10

-Half Life 2 oynamadan bu oyunu oynadım ve bi bok anlamadım çünkü zengin bir orul orul orospu çocuguyum.

-Aksiyon yok bu nasıl oyun önermiyorum çünkü ben her yerden bomba patlamasını, sürekli çatışılmasını isteyen manyak adrenalin sapığı piskopatım.

-Sırf half life 2'nin devamı diye oynuyorum yoksa oyun çöp diyebiliyorum çünkü beğenmediğim oyunları zevkle satın alarak oynuyan, zorla oyun oynayan bir gerizekalıyım.

-Oyunda silahım yok gravity gunı napcam diyebiliyorum çünkü silah fetişim var ve bu bir silah oyunu gravityi götüme mi sokayım.

-Ve bu oyunu önermiyorum çünkü beynimi nereye koyduğumu bilmiyorum.
Still waiting for Half-Life 2: Episode Three.

[h1] Geschnittene deutsche Version [/h1]

Das Spiel mag zwar gut - wenn auch ein bisschen sehr kurz - sein, aber für mich ist es Grund genug, eine Warnung auszusprechen, wenn es im dem deutschen Store nur geschnitten erhältlich ist.
Inzwischen gibt es zwar immer den Hinweis auf der Shop-Seite, wenn es sich um ein geschnittens Produkt handelt, aber das macht das Spiel selbst auch nicht besser oder der Originalversion ähnlicher.

Шедевральный эпизод продолжающий историю о приключениях Гордона Фримена.В этой части мне не понравилось ток одно- это продолжительность самой игры, а в целом понравилось все и детализация и графика и локации. 9.5/10 подкачала продолжительность игры, пройти можно за 4 часа максимум.

Чик-чирик, хорош эпизод, но короткий.

Hard to tell, if this is a good "game"!
I love Half Life 2 and thus I was very exited when playing this expansion. The improved graphics over HL2 are very recognizable and improve the atmosphere of the environment, the gameplay is good as it has always been in a HL and a nice additional story is being told after the portal to Xen has been closed in HL2.
BUT:
The expansion is only about 2hrs long and these two hours aren`t exactly the most exciting I`ve spend in my life. It certainly does have one or two extremely well done areas to play in, but in average the levels are rather dull in terms of gameplay.

Overall:
I am glad I only payed about 50 cents for it in sale and I would not want to pay more, since it however tells the story of what is before HL2 Episode 2 it is necessary to know for that. This is why I`d still recommend it, because though it is short ,the story is fine and it is nice to know what happens after the main game especially since the ending of HL2 is not really explaining what happenes with the combine.

Продолжение сюжетной линии Half-Life 2.
После уничтожение ядра Цитадели и убийства мэра Брина, Гордон Фримен с Аликс Вэнс пытаются покинуть Цитадель и спастись от мощного взрыва. В ходе побега парочка помогает повстанцам зачистить улицы от страйдеров и элитных частей Альянса, а так же помогает скрыться беженцам на поезде. Геймплей займет буквально 2 часа времени, но за эти 2 часа вы сможете максимально прочувствовать атмосферу борьбы в Сити 17.

отличный эпизод!! ,  но пора  бы уже Valve перестать плевать в потолок и выпустить:

- Left 4 Dead 3
- Portal 3
- Half-Life 2: Episode 3 или сразу Half-Life 3
- Team-Fortress 3

Ой, подождите... Valve ведь не умеет считать до трёх!

Из всех глав, эта глава с более динамичным, по моему мнению, сюжетом. Сюжет становится более напряженным, когда Гордону и Аликс не удается сбежать из города на военном поезде, после чего героям придётся выбираться своими ногами. Каждая глава не оставит нас равнодушным и даст бурю эмоций, особенно третья "На дне".

Incredible Addition to HL2**

There is no way to undercut this DLC. It is absolutely phenomal and even a casual visitor (such as this reviewer) will likely relish every moment spent playing it, quirks and all. Any return to the Half Life universe is most welcome. This installment begins with the player loading in at precisely the moment HL2 ended. As you can imagine, this only helps deepen the immersion of the journey.

The story of Episode One is the driving force, and well it should be: storytelling seems to take on a new prominence, even for Valve. HL2 was one of the first games in recent memory that made so complete and compelling use of NPCs to really advance the story. The writing, direction and pacing of the story not only continues to be first rate: it actually gets better. That didn't seem possible given how utterly fantastic HL2 is, but Valve found a way to do it. Facial animations are unreal (remember, this DLC originally came out in 2005-6) and the voice acting is incredible. AND THIS IS A FREAKING SHOOTER. If this genre is supposed to inspire the feelz, shouldn't it be limited to excitement and anticipation? Not an emotional rollercoaster of tension, fear, relief, wonder and suspense?

Speaking of being a shooter, the level of difficulty is increased accordingly. While not insurmountable, those players who had been looking for more of a challegne should be pleased: Episode One returns players to a time when combat decisions matter. More use of the functions of the HEV suit (flashlight, oxygen, etc) and some good puzzles/lateral thinking help here, as well. Also, there is noticeably less ammunition. It's no longer possible to blast your way through EVERY problem encountered. A bit of finesse (or fleet-footedness) will be required.

**But for all these changes, there were some struggles. At times, it feels as though Episode One shines a spotlight on some of the things HL2 struggled with. It was very cool to learn more about Alyx and watch her character develop. It was far less cool to watch her do virtually everything of consequence in the game. As a player, it's frustrating to have nearly every action (for story or game play progression) require NPC input. At this point, we've watched Gordon Freeman (the only 'theoretical physicist' who can single-handledly take out entire teams of Recon Marines, Delta Force-level goons, previously unknown armored alien vehicles like Striders and more) solve every problem thrown at him. To 'need' someone else to open every door for him, or tell him where to go seems a bit... contrived. Forced. Less fun. Advancing the goals of humanity was, until this point, a task left almost entirely in the hands of one person. But suddenly, someone else is required to help. It also seems a disservice to Alyx, as she is strong and capable. Does she really need Gordon to do these things? No, and that makes the relationship seem insincere at times. In those moments, it's not about seeing Gordon and Alyx struggle and grow together; it's about having a semi-emotional vehicle that attempts to justify itself as a means to shoe-horn the story forward. 

Regardless of the criticism offered in this review, it must be remembered that this content is still well worth the investment (in finances and time). That statement is true of any addition to the HL franchise, be it episodic, stand-alone or even only tangentially related (Portal, et al). Similarly, even with these few subjectively negative oberservations, Episode One is a part of one of the best, most powerful and enduring franchises in video game history. Not only that, but it is part of an amazing progression in storytelling, as well. Conceptually, the HL universe is compelling and completely engrossing. This DLC continues in that tradition beautifully... even if that beauty is marred by a miniscule, nigh-on microscopic blemish.

8/10. Incredible. Episode One is head and shoulders better than many of its peers in the FPS genre. Peers that are full-fledged, core/base games that take tens of hours to complete, not a DLC/add-on that takes a mere handful of hours to play through.

edit: 'not longer' is less awesome than 'no longer'. ;-)

Half-Life 2: Episode One vem para dar continuidade a história do jogo principal a partir de onde parou, agora nesse jogo tem como foco a Alyx que vai te acompanhar praticamente o jogo todo e te ajudar nessa nova jornada, quase totalmente igual ao game original, mas com algumas mudanças como um novo inimigo o Zumbine (dois se você considerar o Stalker, mas eles não te acatam, só atrapalham) e uma nova “arma” que é um sinalizador que pode ser usado para queimar os inimigos, só tem um contra que é o jogo ser muito curto de qualquer forma um ótimo jogo e essencial para quem jogou os games anteriores e quer um pouco mais de jogatina e história para completar o entendimento dessa maravilhosa história.

The first hour is bad, the second hour is great, the last hour is incredibly repetitive.

I found this game to be not quite as good as HL2. You start out with only the gravity gun and you don't find most of your weapons until very far into the episode. The story takes up right after the end of Half Life 2, and follows Alex and Gordon escaping from City 17. 

The beginning looked promising, but until the middle when you finally find an SMG it it stays quite boring. It's slow and feels like a chore at many moments throughout. Especially near the end when it turns into a huge escort mission.

I say if you want to keep up with the story you must play it but I don't think I can "recommend​" it which is sad, because the base game and Episode 2 are incredibly good.
Хорошо
Its half life

This is simply the best game of all time. Just finished for the 4th time. Steam, please give us the next half life game. It will be the biggest release in all of gaming history. So even if it is somehow not satisfactory you'll still earn an enormous revenue. So, you've got nothing to lose. 
I can speak only for myself, and all i wanna say is that i don't even care how it will be. I just want some more of half life man, as do all of the fans. 
It is just criminal to end the 2nd episode in the biggest twist in the game and not follow it up. 

Anyway, steam people, if you guys are reading this, i just want to thank all of you for making my life so much better. Please keep making games just like before. Don't change the "single player narrative-driven" approach to games. I think we all need a little bit of old-school hardcore gaming in our lives just like in the earlier steam games.

Thank you, Steam.

Geill

La suite sur laquelle on se précipite littéralement quand on termine l'histoire de Half-Life 2.
Le jeu est très court, même s'il contient 5 chapitres, il est dévoré très rapidement. Malgré tout, l'histoire s'enchaîne très vite, et nous tient toujours en haleine. Pas le temps de terminer une action ou un combat, qu'il y a un retournement de situation, et qu'on est balancé dans autre chose ! Il avance et complète très bien l'histoire de son prédécesseur. Un must-have pour tous ceux qui ont adoré Half-Life 2, sans l'ombre d'un doute !

Un bon conseil cependant : si vous voulez vous essayer à Half-Life 2, jouez vraiment au 1 avant. Puis aussi à Opposing Force et Blue Shift (qui décrivent les évènements du 1 avec un autre point de vue). Ainsi, vous serez moins largués dans le 2 et ses Episodes, et pourrez profiter pleinement de l'histoire et de l'aventure.

Je recommande très, très vivement la série entière !

[h1] Introduction [/h1]

Half-Life 2 : Episode 1 is a direct continuation of Half-Life 2, following Gordon Freeman's escape from City 17.



[h1] Review [/h1]

Imagine Half-Life 2 with enhanced, better graphics and a lot more colors! It is a more than worthy continuation of Half-Life 2 in which the same formula with Half-Life 2 has been kept, with the same successful and satisfying result. The only flaw that i find from this game is that it is very short. I finished the game in just 3 hours. 

[h1] pros [/h1]

-New improved graphics.
-DOG.
-Same successful formula as it's predecessor.
-Amazing soundtrack and music.
-Flawless voice acting.

[h1] cons [/h1]

-It's a very short game. (3 hours)

[h1] Worth it? [/h1]

It's included in "The Orange Box" bundle so yes, it is.

[h1] Score [/h1]

A solid 90 due to the length (too short).
it's okay

So far fan reaction has been pretty good, and I do feel bad saying the game is short when the few hours you get are so taut and well-designed. Will Valve make a killing off of this? Of course. They also need to think about what a difference an hour or two would make in terms of customer satisfaction.
